newsitem.title: HONG KONG: China's Shenzhen city executes 10 criminals.
newsitem.headline: China's Shenzhen city executes 10 criminals.

text.p: Ten people have been executed in the southern China boomtown of Shenzhen for a variety of crimes including murder and robbery, the Shenzhen Special Zone Daily said on Wednesday.
The newspaper said the 10 were all sentenced in Shenzhen, on the border of Hong Kong, on Tuesday and executed the same day.
It said those executed included one man from Sichuan who killed another man who accused him of being lazy.

Executions in China are usually carried out with a single bullet to either the heart or the back of the head. Chinese officials say frequent use of the death penalty is essential to combat a rising tide of crime around the country.
